import numpy as np

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y = train_df['Survived']

# Drop Name, Ticket, and Cabin columns as they are not useful for prediction
X = X.drop(['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)
test_X = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)
test_X = test_X.drop(['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values
# Fill missing age with median
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Embarked'].fillna(X['Embarked'].mode()[0] if not X['Embarked'].mode().empty else 'S', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])

# One-hot encode embarked
X = pd.get_dummies(X, columns=['Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Prepare test data
test_X['Age'].fillna(test_X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_X['Fare'].fillna(test_X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_X['Embarked'].fillna(test_X['Embarked'].mode()[0] if not test_X['Embarked'].mode().empty else 'S', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables in test data
test_X['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(test_X['Sex'])

# One-hot encode embarked in test data
test_X = pd.get_dummies(test_X, columns=['Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Ensure consistent columns
X_columns = X.columns.tolist()
test_X = test_X.reindex(columns=X_columns, fill_value=0)

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X, y)

# Predict
y_pred = model.predict(test_X)

# Create submission
submission =
